channel.title: Heavy Metal
channel.description:
I'm talking REAL Heavy Metal here, not the bullshit pop-core and whatnot most morons listen to.
I'm talking this stuff: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=G14217RGIjc http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XBauwyhhlY4 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2wbHqC90150
The era of heavy metal when it was catchy, fast and in-your-face without resorting to retarded monotone riffs, "breakdowns" and other silly shit.
I'm curious, how many people on this forum actually listen to/like this kind of stuff? To be honest i'm not expecting anyone to, but hey! surprise me.

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Too many genres. To me, there is basically Bluegrass, Old Country (new country is basically Pop), Blues, Pop, Rap (Crap), and Rock. Don’t split hairs. Everything in this thread falls under Rock.

I find it rather interesting to see the evolution of a genre. Being a musician myself, I’ve met plenty of musicians describing my music differently and placing it under a different genre, but basically that doesn’t matter as long as the music is good.

So I understand your vision, but yet love watching documentaries on the evolution of music and I think that it supplies some kind of grip to musicians.

Read full topic

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:52, topic:358975”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=455468.msg3342106#msg3342106 date=1284480348]
Too many genres. To me, there is basically Bluegrass, Old Country (new country is basically Pop), Blues, Pop, Rap (Crap), and Rock. Don’t split hairs. Everything in this thread falls under Rock.
[/quote]might as well say all music with acoustic guitars is country then, or all music with pianos is jazz. Hard rock and metal are the broadest genres there is, stuff varies so much that you simply cannot just call it “rock”[/quote]It really depends how deeply you listen to the music. Someone who doesn’t care much for them might not be able to see much of a difference.

Read full topic

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

Speljohan:

If that’s the way to define it, then hardcore is considered heavy metal (simply not acceptable)

No, it’s not. That’s why it’s being called Hardcore, not Heavy Metal.

Read full topic

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“jensie, post:48, topic:358975”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=455468.msg3342088#msg3342088 date=1284478883]
i never considered sabbath, deep purple etc heavy metal at all. It was pretty much hard rock.
[/quote]
It’s not about what you think is Heavy Metal, it’s about what is generally accepted as Heavy Metal.[/quote]If that’s the way to define it, then hardcore is considered heavy metal (simply not acceptable)

Read full topic

item.description:

Speljohan:

i never considered sabbath, deep purple etc heavy metal at all. It was pretty much hard rock.

It’s not about what you think is Heavy Metal, it’s about what is generally accepted as Heavy Metal.

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“jensie, post:46, topic:358975”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=455468.msg3334978#msg3334978 date=1283809114]
iron maiden was one of the bands to start the whole heavy metal movement along with judas priest (judas priest being the better band by a longshot)
[/quote]Maiden was considered New Wave of British Heavy Metal (NWOBHM), along with bands like Def Leppard, Saxon, Diamond Head, … They were actually more punk-influenced than Heavy Metal and became popular after the decline of the Heavy Metal genre (Black Sabbath, Led Zeppelin, Deep Purple…).
Nowadays though, Heavy Metal kind of covers a mixture between Heavy Metal and NWOBHM.

And I strongly disagree on the Priest/Maiden issue.[/quote]i never considered sabbath, deep purple etc heavy metal at all. It was pretty much hard rock.

Read full topic

Nowadays though, Heavy Metal kind of covers a mixture between Heavy Metal and NWOBHM.

And I strongly disagree on the Priest/Maiden issue.

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

i almost forgot mentioning these, there’s some really good shit like:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lhNBwRrDSBU (yes, these guys are nearly kids!)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ybV8LLp_wo (i was there!)
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IsiNSovDvMI
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVEi3nFpWAI

All of these are part of a metal revolution right here in sweden, nicknamed “the new wave of swedish heavy metal”. So yeah, metal isn’t dead, in fact it is coming back now!

EDIT:

Since some people have mentioned thrash acts, this is one of the best bands to have ever been in that genre (incredible live):

Read full topic

Rammstein - Amerika
Black Sabbath - Children of the Grave [/quote]Please take the Rammstein song and Metallica’s Orion. Orion is just so… Ugly, and the only song I’ve ever had to delete out of my song library that was by Metallica.

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

i have an ax:

Anyone like Dream Theater?

inb4 lawl.

I am also a big fan too. All the songs you mentioned are win, but you should give Pull me under, Octavarium (this is quite new), Another day a mention although these songs are less heavy and more progressive.
Even though we’re talking about old metal, Dream theaters newest album contains a few good songs: Forsaken, The best of times, The dark eternal night, Wither.

I just listen to whatever Speljohan_ forces me to listen.

Read full topic

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @i_have_an_ax i have an ax
item.description:
@i_have_an_ax wrote:

Anyone like Dream Theater? They’re progressive metal, but pretty heavy too. They’re more '90s-oriented, though, I think.

I would recommend The Glass Prison (links to part 1), Panic Attack, A Change Of Seasons (links to part 1), Erotomania, and (can’t find a good YouTube link) The Dance Of Eternity.

Read full topic

item.title: Heavy Metal
item.dc:creator: @Ace1 Ace.
item.description:
@Ace1 wrote:

Euhm, I’m into more modern metal rather than slightly older bands such as Metalica. I’m not sure if the latest Lamb of God stuff is classified as ‘Heavy Metal’, but I would say that some of their slightly older stuff is Heavy Metal.

Although, I do prefer Death Metal. Bands like Chelsea Grin are some pretty heavy shit. Your thoughts?

Read full topic

I thought “ooo, Metal”
But i cannot relate to that sort.

Here - This is my kind

Metalica - Fuel
As Blood Runs Black - Hester Prynne
In This Moment - The Great Divide…
